org.transitime.ipc.rmi

Class ClientFactory<T extends java.rmi.Remote>

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.transitime.ipc.rmi.ClientFactory<T>

  • public class ClientFactory<T extends java.rmi.Remote>
extends java.lang.Object
    For clients to access RMI based method calls for a remote object simply need to call something like: Hello hello = ClientFactory.getInstance(agencyId, Hello.class);
    Author:
    SkiBu Smith

    • Method Detail

      • getInstance

        public static <T extends java.rmi.Remote> T getInstance(java.lang.String agencyId,
                                                        java.lang.Class<T> clazz)
        This serves as a factory class For a Remote object. It is expected that a new instance is created every time getInstance() is called. This is reasonable because usually will only be creating a single such object and if there are a few that is fine as well since they are not that expensive.
        Parameters:
        host - Where remote object lives
        agencyId - For creating bind name for remote object
        clazz - Because this is a static method the only way to get the class name is to pass in the class.
        Returns:
        Proxy to the RMI object on the server. If there is a problem accessing the object then null is returned.

      • getRmiStub

        public static <T extends java.rmi.Remote> T getRmiStub(RmiStubInfo info,
                                                       boolean updateHostName)
                                                throws java.rmi.RemoteException,
                                                       java.rmi.NotBoundException
        Creates an RMI stub based on the project name, host name, and class name. An RMI stub is a remote reference to an object.
        Parameters:
        info - Species the agency ID and the host name
        updateHostName - Indicates whether should update host name instead of just getting old values from cache. Should update if there is a problem in invoking an RMI call since perhaps the server for an agency was moved to a new hostname. But when first creating a client factory don't want to access db so should just use cached value.
        Returns:
        The RMI stub for the remote object
        Throws:
        java.rmi.RemoteException
        java.rmi.NotBoundException

      • getTimeoutSec

        public static int getTimeoutSec()
        Returns the timeout time. Useful for error messages.
        Returns:
        Timeout time in seconds

      • main

        public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
        Just for debugging.
        Parameters:
        args -
